title: Modern Project Management - Quality, Risk, Procurement and Project Closeout - Revised
headline: Learn to take control of your project and ensure that goals are strategically aligned with this free online course.
description: This free online Project Quality Management course focuses on Quality, Risk, Procurement, and Project Closeout. A good project manager is the glue that holds a project together, ensuring quality and objectives are met on time and on budget. With this course, you will learn how to guide quality control procedures throughout the project life-cycle, assess risk, set up and run a project procurement system, and closeout projects successfully.

courseDescription:
This course will first look into the historical events and forces that led up to today’s emphasis on quality as a competitive requirement. You will then study quality programs and standards such as TQM, Six Sigma, and ISO 9000 as well as learn the similarities and differences between process quality management and project quality management. The course will also discuss the sources of information for the planning process and the techniques for controlling project quality.

Next, you will study statistical measurement terminology and learn the purpose and methods of quality assurance. The course will discuss project risk, the difference between the business risk of the organization and project risk, and the major elements involved in managing project risk during the initiation, planning, execution, and closeout phases. Finally, you will study the relationship between project risk and external, internal, technical, and environmental complexity.

This Modern Project Management - Managing Quality Control, Risk, Procurement and Project Closeout online course is the last in a series of courses designed for efficient contemporary project management. Do you want to learn the core principles of project management from efficient planning and organizing to leading and managing resources and tasks to achieve specific business goals? By the end of this course, you will have learned how to analyze and bring together the required materials and professionals to ensure project success.

Start Course Now

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Introduction to Project Quality and Statistics
modules.description: Learn about quality control in project management using statistics to interpret data, development of quality as a competitive advantage, relevance of quality programs to project quality, planning and controlling project quality, and assuring quality.
topics: Development of Quality as a Competitive Advantage
Relevance of Quality Programs to Project Quality

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Evaluating risks for likelihood and impact is a key aspect of project management. In this module you’ll learn about defining, evaluating and managing risk, analyzing project risk by phases, and explore the relationship between project risk and the project complexity profile.
topics: Project Risk and the Project Complexity Profile

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn more about the procurement process in modern project management in this module from identifying the need for resources outside the organization, planning process for procurement, selecting the contract type, and the procurement process.
topics: Identifying the Need for Resources Outside the Organization

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn more about the closure phase in modern project management in this module, from procedures for closing out contracts, to post-project review processes, documents to be archived, and project closeout celebrations.

modules.name: Module
topics: Quality Control, Risk, Procurement and Project Closeout Assessment

  • Learning Objectives

  • Upon successful completion of this topic, you should be able to:
    • Discuss the distinct aspects of a project referred to by the term Project quality. 
    • Identify the similarities between process quality management and project quality management. 
    • Distinguish between process and project quality management. 
    • Analyze the importance of considering Cost of Quality in the project scope. 
    • Discuss how the separation of costs and benefits can lead to short-term savings but a higher cost of failure after a project is complete.
    • Explain the importance of the separation of responsibility.

    • Define and explain statistical terms used in quality control.

    • Explain and calculate the standard deviation.
